descriptive_summary.author: Megan Mummey
descriptive_summary.title: Crum/Dale family papers
descriptive_summary.prefercite: 2012ms017: [identification of item], Crum/Dale family papers, 1870-1909, University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: The Crum family was originally from Oldham County, Kentucky. Gilbert Lafayette Crum and Mary E. Crum Dale's father was Jacob Crum; they had four other siblings. Gilbert Crum moved to California prior to 1870 to work as a farmer. Gilbert Crum is buried in Eminence, Kentucky.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Crum/Dale family papers (dated 1870-1909; 0.15 cubic feet; 1 box) consist of letters and a legal document document the family's relationship with Gilbert L. Crum, a relative in California. Gilbert Crum wrote the letters to his sister Mary E. Dale, his nephews, and his father Jacob Crum. The content of his letters describe his struggles as a farmer in California. The legal document is a 1902 copy of Jacob Crum's 1897 will.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: Collection is open to researchers by appointment.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: The physical rights to the materials in this collection are held by the University of Kentucky Libraries Special Collections Research Center.
